p: From February 2017 to July 2018, 1315 patients were screened for eligibility, and 258 patients were enrolled ( Figure 1). Baseline clinical characteristics and microbiological aetiologies were presented in Table 1. One or more pathogens were identified in 116 (45%) patients ( Table 1, Supplementary Figure 1). Fifty-two patients (20%) had viral pneumonia (most commonly influenza viruses [12%] and rhinovirus [7%]), 38 (15%) had bacterial pneumonia ( S pneumoniae [12%], Hemophilus influenzae [7%], and M pneumoniae [1%], and 23 (9%) had polymicrobial pneumonia. Among those with a viral pathogen identified (N = 73), 20 (27%) had a bacterial copathogen ( S pneumoniae 13, H influenzae 6, and Legionella 1). Bacterial pathogens in 93% of patients with bacterial pneumonia (excluding atypical pathogens) were susceptible to amoxicillin-clavulanate.
